title: 112_hr2728
content: The Act titled "Corporate Politics Transparency Act" requires disclosure of certain political expenditures to shareholders. The Corporate Politics Transparency Act amends the Securities Exchange Act to require disclosure of political expenditures in quarterly and annual reports, including candidate names, party affiliations, amounts spent, and offices sought. The Corporate Politics Transparency Act requires disclosure of political expenditures, including candidate names, party affiliations, amounts spent, and offices sought. Political expenditure in support of or opposition to any candidate for public office exceeding $10,000 is defined as an independent expenditure. The Corporate Politics Transparency Act mandates disclosure of political expenditures, including candidate names, party affiliations, and amounts spent. Any proxy solicitation for a security must disclose total political expenditures supporting or opposing candidates for public office. The Corporate Politics Transparency Act requires disclosure of political expenditures supporting or opposing candidates for public office, including candidate names, party affiliations, amounts spent, and issuer's interest in making such expenditures. Registration statements under the Securities Act of 1933 must include this information. The Securities Act of 1933 is amended to require disclosure of political expenditures in support of or opposition to candidates for public office, including candidate names, party affiliations, amounts spent, and issuer's interest in making such expenditures. The Securities Exchange Act of 1934 will be modified to facilitate disclosures required by amendments related to political expenditures.
